thread.title: Gwinnett police: 4-year-old girl missing, taken by mother
thread.title_full: Gwinnett police: 4-year-old girl missing, taken by mother

author: Amanda C. Coyne
title: Gwinnett police: 4-year-old girl missing, taken by mother
text:
Gwinnett County police are looking for 4-year-old Serenity Dudley, who is believed to have been taken by her 21-year-old mother, Chastity Dudley.
Gregory Miller, Serenityâ€™s father, was recently granted full custody of his daughter by the DeKalb County Superior Court in September 2016. Before papers regarding custody were served to Chastity Dudley, police believe she took Serenity from her Peachtree Corners home.
Miller has not seen or known the whereabouts of his daughter or Chastity Dudley in nearly six months.
MORE: Police looking for suspects in Gwinnett Metro PCS burglary
Police do not believe Serenity Dudley is at any risk of harm.
The Gwinnett County Police Department asks anyone with information to call 770-513-5300 or call Crime Stoppers at 404-577-8477. Tips to Crime Stoppers can remain anonymous.
